attributes.action: Review the Digital Britain procedures on illegal file sharing throttling and disconnections
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Digital Britain report which is currently making its way through parliament plans to force MP's to impose sanctions on people accused of "illegal file sharing" via p2p software such as Bitorrent. Under the current RIPA laws interception of data is classified as a criminal offence as it undermimes customer privacy, the government and the ISP's do not possess the means to catch determined filesharers and innocent people will be persecuted NOT the culprits, how can the governemt in the same report state that broadband access is a human right, then deny access to innocent users?
